parameters.content:
## 🧩 SECTION 1: **🔘 Manual Start + 📝 Set Target Technology**

### 🎯 Purpose:

This section allows **you (the user)** to manually start the workflow and specify **which technology** (e.g., Shopify, WordPress, React) you're interested in searching for via BuiltWith.

### 🔹 Nodes:

* **🔘 Manual Trigger** (`Manual Trigger`)
  ➤ This lets you run the workflow manually while testing or for one-time actions.
  📍 Tip: Great for workflows that don't need to run on a schedule.

* **📝 Set Technology** (`Set` Node)
  ➤ You manually define the **technology name** here (e.g., "Shopify").
  ➤ You can add a field like:

  ```json
  {
    "technologies": "Shopify"
  }
  ```

  ✅ This makes the workflow dynamic — you can change the tech each time without editing multiple nodes.

### 🔰 What a beginner learns here:

* How to use the **Manual Trigger** to run a test or ad-hoc job.
* How to use the **Set Node** to insert static/custom data into the flow.
* How workflows can be made flexible with variables like `technologies`.

---

## 🔗 SECTION 2: **🌐 Fetch + 🧠 Process BuiltWith Data**

### 🎯 Purpose:

Use the HTTP Request node to connect with the BuiltWith API, and then process the JSON response to extract useful data about the websites.

### 🔹 Nodes:

* **🌐 Fetch BuiltWith Data** (`HTTP Request`)
  ➤ Sends a `GET` request to BuiltWith’s API to find websites using the selected technology.
  ➤ Example URL:

  ```
  https://api.builtwith.com/v20/api.json?KEY=YOUR_API_KEY&TECH=Shopify&START=0
  ```

  🔑 Make sure to replace `YOUR_API_KEY` with your real BuiltWith API key.

* **🧠 Extract Site Info** (`Function` Node)
  ➤ This node parses the JSON response from BuiltWith and pulls out the key fields:

  * `domain`
  * `technology`
  * `firstIndexed`
  * `vertical`
    ➤ Example output (ready for sheets):

  ```json
  {
    "domain": "www.example-shop.com",
    "technology": "Shopify",
    "firstIndexed": "2024-11-02",
    "vertical": "E-commerce"
  }
  ```

### 🔰 What a beginner learns here:

* How to use the **HTTP Request** node to work with any public API.
* How to read API documentation (BuiltWith) and form queries.
* How to process complex API responses using a **Function Node** to extract and clean data.

---

## 📊 SECTION 3: **📄 Log to Google Sheets**

### 🎯 Purpose:

Store the clean data into a Google Sheet so that it can be used for:

* Lead generation
* Email campaigns
* Technology tracking
* Competitor research

### 🔹 Node:

* **📄 Log to Google Sheet** (`Google Sheets → Append`)
  ➤ Appends the parsed data from the previous step to your spreadsheet.
  ➤ Each row represents a different website using the technology.
  ➤ Example columns:

  * A: Domain
  * B: Technology
  * C: First Indexed
  * D: Vertical

🔐 You’ll authenticate this once using Google OAuth2 — n8n saves the connection for future runs.

=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

# ✨ **n8n Workflow: Monitor Tech Stack with BuiltWith & Send Email Alerts**

---

## 🔶 **SECTION 1: Trigger & Input Setup**

🧩 *Nodes Involved:*
1️⃣ `Trigger: Manual Run`
2️⃣ `Set: BuiltWith Parameters`

---

### 🎯 **What Happens Here?**

This section **starts the workflow** and **sets up the inputs** needed to make the BuiltWith API request.

#### 🖱️ 1. `Trigger: Manual Run`

* ⚙️ *Type:* Manual Trigger
* 🔍 *Purpose:* Allows you to **test the workflow manually** by clicking “Execute Workflow” inside n8n.
* ✅ Useful for debugging or running ad hoc checks.

#### 📝 2. `Set: BuiltWith Parameters`

* 🧪 *Type:* Set Node (manual input field editor)
* 📤 *Purpose:* Adds key input fields such as:

  * `API Key`: Your BuiltWith API Key 🔐
  * `TECH`: The technology you want to track (e.g., `Webflow`, `Shopify`, etc.) 🧱

> 💡 **Beginner Tip:** You can reuse this node to switch techs any time. Just change the `TECH` value to track other platforms like `Shopify`, `Wix`, etc.

---

## 🔷 **SECTION 2: Fetch & Format Website Data**

🧩 *Nodes Involved:*
3️⃣ `Fetch Tech Domains (BuiltWith API)`
4️⃣ `Format BuiltWith Response`

---

### 🧠 **What Happens Here?**

This section talks to the **BuiltWith API**, gets the data, and formats it so it's readable and usable.

#### 🌐 3. `Fetch Tech Domains (BuiltWith API)`

* 🔗 *Type:* HTTP Request Node
* 📡 *Purpose:* Makes a `GET` request to the [BuiltWith API](https://builtwith.com/), asking:

  > “Hey! Show me websites using this specific tech.”
* 🧾 It returns a list of domains using the tech you entered in the previous step, including:

  * Domain name 🌐
  * First detected date 📅
  * Other technologies found 🧩

#### 🛠️ 4. `Format BuiltWith Response`

* 🧮 *Type:* Code Node (JavaScript)
* 🧠 *Purpose:* Extracts and formats the response into clean, readable values:

  * `Domain`: `example1.com`
  * `Technologies`: `Webflow, Stripe, Google Analytics`
  * `First Detected Dates`: `2025-06-04, N/A, 2025-06-05`

> 💡 **Beginner Tip:** This code transforms messy JSON into something clear, which you can now send in an email, Slack, or save in Airtable.

---

## 🟥 **SECTION 3: Send Email Alert**

🧩 *Node Involved:*
5️⃣ `Send Alert Email (Gmail)`

---

### 📬 **What Happens Here?**

This final section takes the formatted data and **sends it to your inbox** using Gmail.

#### 📤 5. `Send Alert Email (Gmail)`

* ✉️ *Type:* Gmail Node
* 🔔 *Purpose:* Sends you an email for each domain found using the tech.
* 🔍 Includes:

  * Domain name
  * All technologies used
  * Detection dates
* 🧑‍💼 Perfect for sending leads to your **sales**, **BD**, or **marketing team**.

> 💡 **Beginner Tip:** You can change the "To" address to send alerts to team members, or use conditional logic to notify only when specific techs are found.

---

## 🌟 **Summary: Why This Workflow is Powerful**

| Benefit 💡                  | Description                                                                |
| --------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 🔍 Discover Leads           | Automatically find websites using tools your business supports or sells to |
| 📧 Instant Alerts           | Get notified via Gmail when new websites appear                            |
| 🧩 Highly Customizable      | Change tech stack (e.g. `Webflow`, `Shopify`, `WordPress`) in seconds      |
| 🚫 No-Code-Friendly         | Easy to maintain even if you're not a developer                            |
| 🏗️ Reusable Building Block | Can be extended to Slack, Airtable, or CRM integrations                    |

---

Technologies.Name: Shopify
Technologies.Description: Shopify is a hosted ecommerce platform.

_metadata.name: Track Technology Changes with BuiltWith and Log to Google Sheets
